raven_checkers_file.game_description:
**Single Corner** opening, part of the 11-15 group.
11-15 is considered Black's best opening move. It is so popular that it has branched off into more openings than any other initial move. Among the replies that can be recommended for White are 23-19 or 23-18 or 22-18 or 22-17. On the other hand, 24-20 and 24-19 and 21-17 are all considered inferior in varying degrees.
- from //How to Win At Checkers// by Fred Reinfeld

move_description.annotation: 22-18. These moves form the opening, which gives Black a slight initiative -- though White possesses ample resources.
25-18. Here Richard Pask shows that an [[training\Openings\support\SingleCorner_Pask_Variation1.rcf|alternate%20line%20of%20play]] can be chosen after this point.
12-16. Here 8-11 may lead to a trap.

29-25. More conservative than 8-14, which is also playable. Richard Pask recommends a [[training\Openings\support\SingleCorner_Pask.rcf|variation%20in%20play]] starting here in Play Better Checkers and Draughts.
6-10. Or an alternate line with level chances.
